elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: Listen to the podcast "Mental preparation for difficult conversations: How to master them without fear" and answer the questions in the exercise.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: What percentage of people do not dare to address problems directly?

elements.name: question2
elements.title: How many hours are wasted at work because you don't have the courage to address a difficult situation?

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What two fears do many people have when it comes to addressing a conflict?
elements.correctAnswer: The fear of saying the wrong thing or not being able to express yourself properly and the fear of making a damaged relationship even worse.

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Listen to the podcast "Mental preparation for difficult conversations: How to master them without fear" and answer the questions in the exercise.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: The author of the podcast mentions a modified form of non-violent communication as a solution to the problem. What do the letters F.B.I. stand for?
elements.correctAnswer: F: Feelings, B: Behavior, I: Impact

elements.name: question5
elements.title: How could the conflict with the roommate be resolved using the F.B.I. method?
elements.correctAnswer: Q: I'm very tired because I listen to your music every night. / B: The bass of your music reaches me through the thin walls. / I: If it goes on like this, I'll have to call the police for causing a disturbance or let the landlord know, even though I don't really want to.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: The podcast also talks about a win-win situation. What advantage could you formulate for the bad-tempered neighbor so that she also sees an advantage in this difficult situation?
elements.correctAnswer:
I tried to talk to you first and didn't go straight to the police or the landlord.
I can offer to tell you when I'm going on vacation or on which evenings I'm not at home.
